DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine feasibility use intracervical balloon catheter cervical ripen part labour induction healthy , GBS-negative woman prelabour rupture membrane term .
DOC.brief_title: Intracervical Catheters Induction Labour Women With Prelabour Rupture Membranes Term
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize controlled trial compare two method induction labour pregnant , GBS-negative woman present prelabour rupture membrane term . The intervention consist insertion double-balloon intracervical catheter time induction , follow immediately oxytocin infusion . The control consist standard therapy : oxytocin induction . Our primary outcome feasibility , secondary outcome length first second stage labour , rate vaginal delivery , intrapartum fever , chorioamnionitis , NICU admission , suspect proven neonatal sepsis , serious neonatal complication .
DOC.criteria: Singleton Pregnancy 37.0 41.0 gestational age Confirmed Rupture Membranes Group B Streptococcus Negative Cephalic Presentation Absence contraction least 60 minute follow rupture Absence contraction time enrolment Contraindication Vaginal Delivery Previous Uterine Surgery , include Caesarean Section Previous Cerclage , Cone Biopsy , LEEP , Cervical Surgery Documented history cervical incompetence High Grade intraepithelial lesion , adenocarcinoma situ , invasive cervical cancer . Immunosuppressed State Active Vaginal Infection
